title: Sound Opinions Show
teaser: D.C. indie rockers The Dismemberment Plan are back from a break-up with their first new album in over ten years. They join host Greg Kot in studio for a special live performance and conversation.
contentencoded:
NEWS: 
• Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot report on the top prizes at last weeks Grammy awards, including a surprise win for dance duo Daft Punk
• Influential folk singer and songwriter Pete Seeger died on Monday at age 94. Jim and Greg discuss his legacy and play the controversial anti-war song "Waist Deep in the Big Muddy.”
FEATURE:
Greg welcomes the recently re-formed Washington D.C. indie band The Dismemberment Plan to the Sound Opinions studio. Band members Eric Axelson (bass), Jason Caddell (guitar), Joe Easley (drums), and Travis Morrison (vocals and guitar) disbanded more than 10 years ago at the height of their popularity. They returned in 2013 with their album “Uncanny Valley” and a subsequent tour which led them to the Sound Opinions studios.  
REVIEW:
Jim and Greg review After the Disco, the second album from Broken Bells, the superstar duo of The Shins’ James Mercer and producer Brian Burton a.k.a. Danger Mouse.
YOUR SOUND OPINIONS:
At the end of the show we hear comments from listeners.
